_source.text: A cheerful fire blazed in his garret, and Mrs. Snooks had prepared for him the favourite blade-bone he loved (blest four-days' dinner for a bachelor - roast, cold, hashed, grilled bladebone, the fourth being better than the first); but although he usually did rejoice in this meal - ordinarily, indeed, grumbling that there was not enough to satisfy him - he, on this occasion, after two mouthfuls, flung down his knife and fork, and buried his two claws in his hair.
